comments.comment: This is definitely related to <denchmark-link:https://github.com/mlpack/mlpack/issues/468>#468</denchmark-link> ; I think it's actually the same issue, so I'll close this and comment there.

This is not a duplicate. In <denchmark-link:https://github.com/mlpack/mlpack/issues/468>#468</denchmark-link> there was nothing to do in mlpack. Here you know you are opening a binary file and yet you are not providing the ios::binary flag. Hence boost::serialization fails. My suggestion is to always provide the binary flag. If I do that in serial_test.cpp then all tests pass except DET Test. Does that test pass on Linux/Unix?
I did a full rebuild and the test now passes

I ran the test on Visual Studio with Boost Test Plugin. The DET test now passes on my box. Even earlier if I create a separate test project with only DET Test then it succeeds. It could be because multiple tests are being run concurrently. On Wed, Nov 25, 2015 at 5:55 AM, Ryan Curtin <denchmark-link:mailto:notifications@github.com>notifications@github.com</denchmark-link>
